{{BLP refimprove|date=July 2024}} {{Short description|American guitarist, singer, and songwriter}} {{Use mdy dates|date=December 2020}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Al Anderson | image = AlAnderson.jpg | caption = | image_size = | birth_name = Alan Gordon Anderson | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1947|7|26}} | birth_place = [[Windsor, Connecticut]], United States | alias = Big Al Anderson | origin = | instrument = Vocals
guitar | genre = Rock
[[Country music|Country]] | occupation = Singer-songwriter | years_active = 1966–present | label = | past_member_of = [[NRBQ]] | website = }} '''Alan Gordon Anderson''' (born July 26, 1947) is an American guitarist, singer, and songwriter. In the 1960s, Anderson was the frontman of the band [[the Wildweeds]],{{Cite web|url=http://www.wildweeds.net/bio.html|title=The Wildweeds – Biography|website=Wildweeds.net|access-date=March 5, 2020}} which had success with the song "No Good To Cry",{{Cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=g52IEEhAnSk |archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/varchive/youtube/20211213/g52IEEhAnSk |archive-date=2021-12-13 |url-status=live|publisher=YouTube|title=No Need to Cry|date=June 6, 2013 |access-date=March 5, 2020}}{{cbignore}} which he wrote. Between December 1971 and December 1993, he was the lead guitarist in the rock band [[NRBQ]], also releasing several solo albums. He also played electric guitar on [[Jonathan Edwards (musician)|Jonathan Edwards]]'s 1973 album ''[[Have a Good Time for Me]]''. In the 1990s, Anderson shifted his focus to country music, writing hit songs for such artists as [[Carlene Carter]], [[Vince Gill]], [[Diamond Rio]] and [[Trisha Yearwood]], as well as [[Tim McGraw]]'s number 1 hit "[[The Cowboy in Me]]" and several album cuts. Anderson has also released six solo albums.{{cite web |url={{AllMusic|class=artist|id=p3541/biography|pure_url=yes}} |title=Al Anderson biography |access-date=June 5, 2008 |last=Deming |first=Mark |website=[[AllMusic]]}} ==Discography== ===Albums=== *''Al Anderson'' ([[Vanguard Records]], 1972) *''Party Favors'' ([[Rykodisc]], 1988) *''Pay Before You Pump'' ([[Imprint Records]], 1996) *''After Hours'' (Legacy, 2006) *''Pawn Shop Guitars'' (AAM Records, 2007) *''Strings'' (Amigo Grande, 2012) ===Singles=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! rowspan="2"| Year ! rowspan="2" style="width:18em;"| Single ! colspan="1"| Peak chart
